titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the album 'A Trip in Algeria' by TAYLOR, H. E. Irving AD.MC.040
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman and Emily Broad

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-25 22:01:27 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: 'A trip in Algeria' by H. E. Irving Taylor

physdesc.extent: Album, oblong 8vo (18.2 x 24.5 cm), pp. [2], 48; printed title 'The interchangeable photo-scrap album no trimming or mounting required' (London, M.W. & Co.), 48 black and white glossy prints (10.5 x 15.5 cm)

did.abstract: A visual and written record of a trip to Algeria at the opening of the 20th century (48 images) undertaken by H.E. Irving Taylor and his travelling companion, Mr Shepherd, comprising Taylor's attractive, clear photographs alongside his engaging and enthusiastic accompanying narrative. Taylor and Shepherd's trip, undertaken in January 1902, took them to Algiers, Constantine, El Kantara, Biskra, Sidi Okba, Kherrata, and the Djurdjura mountain range, the pair travelling by train, trap, bicycle, camel, and on foot. Please note: This material has been digitized in its entirety and contains racist and culturally insensitive remarks.
did.physdesc: Album, oblong 8vo (18.2 x 24.5 cm), pp. [2], 48; printed title 'The interchangeable photo-scrap album no trimming or mounting required' (London, M.W. & Co.), 48 black and white glossy prints (10.5 x 15.5 cm) captioned and dated, the first 39 surrounded with ink notes in a neat hand; light foxing to endpapers; bound in dark green cloth, 'Photographs' in gilt to upper cover, 'Algerian photographs' inked to top edge, 'Algeria 1902' to spine; extremities a little worn, spine slightly discoloured; very good; note to verso of title signed 'H. E. Irving Taylor'.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Repository permission is required for access. Please contact Akkasah Center for Photography, akkasah@nyu.edu +971 2628 5531

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Collection acquired from Bernard Quaritch Ltd in August 2018

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Album, oblong 8vo (18.2 x 24.5 cm), pp. [2], 48; printed title 'The interchangeable photo-scrap album no trimming or mounting required' (London, M.W. & Co.), 48 black and white glossy prints (10.5 x 15.5 cm).

bioghist.head: Biographical
bioghist.p: From the Venn Catalogue of Alumni Cantabrigiensis: "Taylor, Henry Edward Irving. Adm. at PEMBROKE, Oct. 1894. 3rd s. of the Rev. Charles Johnson (St John's College, Oxford, 1843), of 'The Larches,' Banstead, Surrey . B. Aug. 24, 1867, at Folkestone. Schools [Blackheath proprietary; The Leys, Cambridge, and] Hanover Square School of electrical engineering and at the City and Guilds College, 1889-92. Employed by the L.B.&.S.C. Railway and at works in Camden Town before residence. Matric. Michs. 1894; B.A. 1897; M.A. 1905. Assistant Master at Crewkerne School, Somerset , 1897-8; private tutor, 1898-1903; Head Master of a private School in Surrey , 1903-32. Of Coolinge, Reigate, Surrey , where he died June 30, 1943. Brother of Decimus A. G. (1890) and Chapman C. A. (1884). ( City and Guilds Coll. Reg.; The Times, July 2, 1943.)"

"Henry Edward Irving TAYLOR Approx. lifespan: 1867–1943 Adm Pembroke College 1894:10 3rd s. of Rev. Charles Johnson TAYLOR ( St John's College [Oxford] (1843), of 'The Larches,' Banstead, Surrey , b. Folkestone, [Kent], 1867:08:24 Schools [Blackheath proprietary [Kent], The Leys, CB, [Cambridgeshire], Hanover Sch: Square School of electrical engineering [London], Sch: City and Sch: Guilds College City and Guilds, [London], 1889-92 Employed: by the L.B.&.S.C. Railway and at works Camden Town, [London], before residence. Matric 1894:10MT: BA 1897 MA 1905 Assistant Master at: : Sch: Crewkerne School Crewkerne, Somerset , 1897-98 private Tutor: 1898-1903 Headmaster of: : private School Surrey , 1903-32 Of Coolinge, Reigate, Surrey , d. 1943:06:30 brother of Decimus A. G. TAYLOR (1890) brother of Chapman C. A. TAYLOR (1884) ( City and Guilds College Reg.; The Times 1943:07:02)"

From the Quaritch catalogue: "Taylor appears to have been a musician – the Bodleian Library holds a number of songs and anthems composed by him, published between 1903 and 1934 – and he clearly took a great interest in Arabic music."

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: A visual and written record of a trip to Algeria at the opening of the 20th century (48 gelatin silver images) undertaken by H.E. Irving Taylor and his travelling companion, Mr Shepherd, comprising Taylor's attractive, clear photographs alongside his engaging, well-written and enthusiastic accompanying narrative. Taylor and Shepherd's trip, undertaken in January 1902, took them to Algiers, Constantine, El Kantara, Biskra, Sidi Okba, Kherrata, and the Djurdjura mountain range, the pair travelling by train, trap, bicycle, camel, and on foot.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the previous owner were transferred to Akkasah center for Photography on 14th August 2018. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah Center for Photography, akkasah@nyu.edu +971 2628 5531

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Album: Trip to Algeria; AD_MC_040; box number; folder number or item identifier; Akkasah Center for Photography, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Digitized, currently undergoing page-level cataloguing - March 2020. Materials were placed in an acid-free sleeve and box. Original caption information, when available, will be transcribed into page-level descriptions. Where captions are illegible, the archivist's interpretation is enclosed in square brackets.
